Race.SpecificTitle: PW School District -- Local Option - Term Limits
Race.FullText:
"LOCAL OPTION ELECTION
Within West Feliciana Parish School District:
Shall the number of terms of office that any member of the school board may serve be limited to three consecutive four-year terms?"

Race.SpecificTitle: PW PJ HRC -- Adopt HRC - PJ
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Home Rule Charter)

Summary:  Proposition to adopt the Home Rule Charter plan of government for the Parish of West Feliciana, State of Louisiana.
Race.FullText: Shall the Home Rule Charter plan of government for West Feliciana Parish prepared and submitted by the duly constituted Home Rule Charter Commission according to Article VI, Section 5 of the Constitution of Louisiana be adopted?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW PJ Prop. #1 -- Disabled Vets. Homestead Exemp. - PJ
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Propositions
Proposition No. 1
(Disabled Veterans Homestead Exemption)

Summary:  Authorizes an additional homestead exemption in the Parish of West Feliciana, State of Louisiana, for certain disabled veterans and surviving spouses in accordance with and subject to the provisions of Article VII, Section 21(K) of the Louisiana Constitution.
Race.FullText: Shall an additional homestead exemption be authorized in the Parish of West Feliciana, State of Louisiana, for certain disabled veterans and surviving spouses in accordance with and subject to the provisions of Article VII, Section 21(K) of the Louisiana Constitution, provided that this additional homestead exemption shall extend and apply to property in West Feliciana Parish only after approval by a majority of the registered voters of West Feliciana Parish voting on this proposition?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW PJ Prop. #2 -- 1 Mill - PJ - 5 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Propositions
Proposition No. 2
(Tax Renewal)

Summary:  5 year, 1 mill property tax renewal for economic development by promoting, encouraging and assisting in the location, development and expansion of agricultural, industrial, manufacturing, professional and/or other businesses and/or concerns in the Parish, including tourism and the funding of educational and promotional programs for the aforesaid purposes.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of West Feliciana, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), levy a special tax of one (1) mill on all property subject to taxation in the Parish (an estimated $267,000 expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of five (5) years, beginning with the year 2013 and ending with the year 2017, for the purpose of economic development by promoting, encouraging and assisting in the location, development and expansion of agricultural, industrial, manufacturing, professional and/or other businesses and/or concerns in the Parish, including tourism and the funding of educational and promotional programs for the aforesaid purposes?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW PJ Prop. #3 -- 1/2% S&U Tax - PJ - 7 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Propositions
Proposition No. 3
(Sales Tax Extension and Rededication)

Summary:  Authority to extend for a term of 7 years, and rededicate the proceeds of, a previously authorized 1/2% sales and use tax of the Parish of West Feliciana for the purposes of acquiring, constructing, maintaining, operating and/or improving buildings, facilities and equipment for the West Feliciana Parish Hospital.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of West Feliciana, State of Louisiana ("the Parish"), be authorized to levy and collect under the provisions of Article VI, Section 29 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974 and other constitutional and statutory authority, a tax of one-half of one percent (1/2%) (the "Tax") upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption, and the storage for use or consumption, of tangible personal property and on sales of services in the Parish, all as defined by law (an estimated $824,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), for an additional period of seven (7) years, commencing May 1, 2013,  the Tax presently being authorized to be collected through April 30, 2013, for maintaining, operating and/or improving the West Feliciana Hospital, and shall the revenues received from both the original and the extended authorizations of the Tax be dedicated and used for the purposes of acquiring, constructing, maintaining, operating and/or improving buildings, facilities and equipment for the West Feliciana Parish Hospital?

Race.SpecificTitle: Sales Tax Dist. #1 Prop.#1 -- 1/2% S&U Tax - PJ - 7 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Sales Tax District No. 1 Propositions
Proposition No. 1
(Sales Tax Extension and Rededication)

Summary:  Authority to extend for a term of 7 years, and rededicate the proceeds of, a previously authorized 1/2% sales and use tax of Sales Tax District No. 1 for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, maintaining, operating and/or improving buildings, facilities and equipment for the West Feliciana Parish Hospital.
Race.FullText: Shall Sales Tax District No. 1 of the Parish of West Feliciana, State of Louisiana (the "District"), be authorized to levy and collect under the provisions of Article VI, Section 29 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974 and other constitutional and statutory authority, a tax of one-half of one percent (1/2%) (the "Tax") upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption, and the storage for use or consumption, of tangible personal property and on sales of services in the District, all as defined by law (an estimated $400,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), for an additional period of seven (7) years, commencing July 1, 2013, the Tax being presently authorized to be collected through June 30, 2013, for maintaining, operating and/or improving the West Feliciana Hospital, and shall the revenues received from both the original and the extended authorizations of the Tax be dedicated and used for the purposes of acquiring, constructing, maintaining, operating and/or improving buildings, facilities and equipment for the West Feliciana Parish Hospital?

Race.SpecificTitle: Sales Tax Dist. #1 Prop.#2 -- 1/2% S&U Tax - PJ - 6 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Sales Tax District No. 1 Propositions
Proposition No. 2
(Sales Tax Renewal)

Summary:  1/2% sales and use tax renewal for 6 years for recreational purposes, provided that up to 25% of the annual proceeds of the tax may be used for social services and programs, with authority to fund the proceeds of the tax into bonds or other indebtedness to pay the cost of capital improvements for such purposes.
Race.FullText: Shall Sales Tax District No. 1 of the Parish of West Feliciana, State of Louisiana (the "District"), under the provisions of Article VI, Section 29 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, and other constitutional and statutory authority supplemental thereto, be authorized to levy and collect and adopt an ordinance providing for such levy and collection, a tax of one-half of one percent (1/2%) (the "Tax") upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption, and the storage for use or consumption, of tangible personal property and on sales of services in the District, all as defined by law (an estimated $400,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of six (6) years, commencing October 1, 2013, with the proceeds of the Tax (after paying the reasonable and necessary expenses of collecting and administering the Tax), to be dedicated and used for the purposes of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining, supporting and/or operating recreational parks, facilities, equipment, programs and services, provided that at the discretion of the governing authority of the District, up to twenty-five percent (25%) of the annual proceeds of the Tax may be used for the purposes of maintaining and supporting social services and programs; and further, shall the District be authorized to fund the proceeds of the Tax into bonds or other indebtedness to pay the cost of capital improvements for such purposes to the extent and in the manner permitted by the laws of Louisiana?
